full_text: Case 1:20-cr-00330-PAE Document 749 Filed 08/10/22 Page 112 of 236 LC3KMAX4 Parkinson - Direct the center right of the page? A. Based on my observation here, it would appear that that would be the residence, 358 El Brillo. Q. Can you please just describe for us where Palm Beach is situated relative to West Palm Beach, please? A. Palm Beach is east of West Palm Beach, and it is a long, thin, what is known as a barrier island. Q. What is in between Palm Beach and West Palm Beach? A. The Intracoastal Waterway. MS. COMEY: We can take that down. Thank you very much, Ms. Drescher. Q. Mr. Parkinson, when you participated in a search of 358 El Brillo Way on October 20, 2005, was that the first time you had been to that address, or had you been there before? A. I had been there one time before. Q. About what year was that? A. 2003. Q. Can you briefly tell us why you were there? A. I was notified at the morning briefing that there had been a report called in from that address of a theft of currency. Q. Thank you, Mr. Parkinson. Did you go to 358 El Brillo Way after hearing that report? A. Yes, I did. Q. Did you meet the owner of the residence? SOUTHERN DISTRICT REPORTERS, P.C. (212) 805-0300 DOJ-OGR-00018213
